mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Type specimens and names assigned to Coprophanaeus (Megaphanaeus) d’Olsoufieff, 1924, the largest New World dung beetles (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Phanaeini)

tax:treatment.tax:nomenclature: Animalia Insecta Coleoptera Scarabaeidae Phanaeus vicinus species Martinez, 1944: 187 Phanaeus vicinusMartínez, 1944: 187. Available name.

tax:div.tax:p:
Type specimen:Holotype: male (BOLIVIA /Dep. Sta. Cruz /Sta. Cruz de la Sierra /F.Monrós-leg. /Coll. Martínez: ’, ‘
Animalia Insecta Coleoptera Scarabaeidae Phanaeus genus Meg. Phanaeus (Meg.) /
Animalia Insecta Coleoptera Scarabaeidae Phanaeus vicinus species vicinus /♂ /sp. n. / A.Martinez-det.1944 ’, ‘HOLOTIPO♂ ’, ‘MACN-En / 1545’, ‘FICHADO ’), genital capsule and right wing dissected and glued to paper card (wing not illustrated by us),MACN (Figure 6 A–B).

tax:p.tax:collection_event: Bolivia Santa Cruz de la Sierra Santa Cruz de la Sierra holotype Type locality: Bolivia : Santa Cruz de la Sierra department.

tax:div.tax:p:
Nomenclatural history:In 1944 Martínez published what he thought to be a new Bolivian species of
Animalia Megaphanaeus genus Megaphanaeus closely related to
Animalia Insecta Coleoptera Scarabaeidae Phanaeus bonariensis species C. bonariensis, which he named
Animalia Insecta Coleoptera Scarabaeidae Phanaeus vicinus species Phanaeus vicinus. Years later,Martínez & Pereira (1967) synonymized
Animalia Insecta Coleoptera Scarabaeidae Phanaeus vicinus species Phanaeus vicinus with
Animalia Insecta Coleoptera Scarabaeidae Phanaeus bonariensis species P. bonariensis, giving the same confusing explanation that they had given for the synonymy between
Animalia Insecta Coleoptera Scarabaeidae Scarabaeus lancifer species P. lancifer and
Animalia Insecta Coleoptera Scarabaeidae Phanaeus septentrionalis species P. septentrionalis (see section above on
Animalia Insecta Coleoptera Scarabaeidae Scarabaeus lancifer species Scarabaeus lancifer): while
Animalia Insecta Coleoptera Scarabaeidae Phanaeus argentinus species P. argentinus would certainly not represent a valid species, it could be proved in the future to be a valid subspecies of
Animalia Insecta Coleoptera Scarabaeidae Phanaeus bonariensis species P. bonariensis. In their review of
Animalia Insecta Coleoptera Scarabaeidae Coprophanaeus genus Edmonds & Zidek (2010) Coprophanaeus,Edmonds & Zídek (2010) endorsed this synonymy without discussing it.

Martínez (1944) stated theholotype of
Animalia Insecta Coleoptera Scarabaeidae Phanaeus vicinus species P. vicinus, the only specimen on which his description was based, was deposited in his personal collection, which today is divided in two distinct institutions: Martínez’sholotypes andallotypes are deposited at the Museo Argentino de Ciencias Naturales ‘Bernardino Rivadavia’,Buenos Aires, whileparatypes and non-type material are housed at the Canadian Museum of Nature, Ottawa, via Henry F. Howden’s collection. Theholotype of
Animalia Insecta Coleoptera Scarabaeidae Phanaeus vicinus species P. vicinus (Figure 6 A) was found by us inMACN and its labels’ information are given above.
